newsitem.title: UK: Amstrad to appeal Seagate award.
newsitem.headline: Amstrad to appeal Seagate award.

text.p: UK consumer electronics group Amstrad Plc said on Tuesday it had been awarded 85.45 million pounds in interest and damages and a substantial part of its costs by a court in its case against America's Seagate Technology Inc.

But Amstrad said it would be appealing all of the decisions relating to interest and taxation. It added that together with its UK and U.S. lawyers, the group was considering bringing a new action in the U.S. against Seagate for alleged fraud to get punitive damages.

Amstrad was last month awarded 57 million pounds in a British legal action against Seagate over the purchase of hard disk drives made by Seagate. A further hearing was to determine interest and costs.
Amstrad is seeking a total settlement of 105 million pounds, including interest on a claim dating back to 1989.
